abstract: Federal authorities, seeking to bring criminal charges against two former JPMorgan Chase employees at the center of the bank’s multibillion-dollar trading loss in London last year, are facing logistical hurdles in planning their arrests.
snippet: Federal authorities, seeking to bring criminal charges against two former JPMorgan Chase employees at the center of the bank’s multibillion-dollar trading loss in London last year, are facing logistical hurdles in planning their arrests.
lead_paragraph: Federal investigators, seeking to bring criminal charges against two former JPMorgan Chase employees at the center of the bank’s multibillion-dollar trading loss in London last year, are facing logistical hurdles in planning arrests.

headline.main: U.S. Faces Obstacles in Bid to Arrest 2 in Big Trading Loss at JPMorgan
headline.print_headline: U.S. Faces Obstacles in Bid to Arrest 2 in Big Trading Loss at JPMorgan

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Jessica Silver-Greenberg
